This app helps you label images quickly and easily through a local web interface. Follow the steps below to build and export your own labeled datasets.

How to Use

üîß 1. Manage Datasets (via Edit Dataset)

  • Add dataset
    1. Choose how many classes (categories) your dataset should have.
    2. Name each of the classes.
    3. Upload your images by selecting a folder from your computer (all images in the folder will be included).
    4. Give your dataset a name.
  • Remove dataset
    • Select any previously added dataset to delete it from the application.
  • Modify datasets
    • Add or remove images from datasets.

üè∑Ô∏è 2. Label Images (via Classify Dataset)

  • Hover over "Classify Dataset" and click on any dataset you've uploaded.
  • The app will show you the last unlabeled image in the dataset.
  • At the bottom, you'll see all your defined categories:
    • Click a category to assign the image to it.
    • Click "Skip" to mark the image as Unknown.
    • Click "Back" to return to the previous image (regardless of label).
  • After labeling or skipping, the next image will load automatically.
  • When all images are labeled or skipped, you'll see a summary screen:
    • Review how many images were skipped.
    • Optionally repeat the labeling process for only the skipped images.

üì§ 3. Export Labeled Data (via Export)

  • Go to the Export page.
  • Select a dataset and export its label mappings as a .csv or .json file.

üìä 4. Analytics dashboard (via Analytics)

  • Go to the Analytics page.
  • Explore statistical information about your data visually and see your labeling progress.
